intro: Sonerila wynaadensis, commonly known as the Wynaad Sonerila, is a flowering plant native to the Western Ghats of India. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and elliptical leaves. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, often in dense undergrowth. Its flowers are usually white or pale pink, with a tubular corolla that attracts pollinators like bees and butterflies. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
